hyperbaric oxygen therapy 高压氧疗法
high optical throughput (endpoint technology) 高出光率（蚀刻终点探测技术）
horizontal output transformer 水平输出变压器

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词都有"热的"之意。
means: hot ： 最普通用词，指温度很高，往往有灼热、滚烫含义。
warm ： 通常指温度不太高，介于hot与cold之间，不太热也不太凉，给人以舒适感。
burning ： 暗示热源是火，多用于夸张，指像火烧一样热。

word_mean: 含危险的放射性物的，强放射性的
hot-wire anemometer 应用金属电阻丝电流加热与风吹散热不断建立平衡的原理测定较小风速的仪器。
smoking 鱼品在50℃~70℃或90℃以上温度下短时间熏制的方法。
denaturation, bake-burning 鲜鱼、咸鱼在较高温度和通风排湿条件不良的闷热状态下人工干燥时发生的 熟化现象。
air drying 用加热的流动空气干燥物料的方法。
扶阳气、祛寒邪等功能的药性。

sentence.Network_en: Wash your hands thoroughly with hot soapy water before handling any food.
sentence.Network_cn: 在拿吃的之前，用热肥皂水把手好好地洗干净。

sentence.Network_en: Across the busy plaza, vendors sell hot dogs and croissant sandwiches.
sentence.Network_cn: 在热闹广场的另一边，摊贩叫卖着热狗和羊角三明治。

sentence.Network_en: The hot liquid splashed down on the concrete and rebounded.
sentence.Network_cn: 滚烫的液体泼在水泥地面上又溅了起来。

critique followed hot on the heels of this pioneering work.

lj.lj_ly: all hot and bothered before the opening performance.

phrase.cizu_name: hot under the collar【非正式用语】

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English hāt, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch heet and German heiss

entry.def: Something that is hot has a high temperature.

example.ex: When the oil is hot, add the sliced onion...
example.tran: 油热了后，放入切好的洋葱。

example.ex: What he needed was a hot bath and a good sleep...
example.tran: 他需要洗个热水澡，好好睡一觉。

entry.tran: 天气热的;气温高的;炎热的
entry.def: Hot is used to describe the weather or the air in a room or building when the temperature is high.

example.ex: It was too hot even for a gentle stroll...
example.tran: 天太热，连慢慢散步都吃不消。

example.ex: It was a hot, humid summer day...
example.tran: 这是个炎热潮湿的夏日。

entry.def: If you are hot, you feel as if your body is at an unpleasantly high temperature.

example.ex: I was too hot and tired to eat more than a few mouthfuls...
example.tran: 我又热又累，只吃了几口就吃不下了。

example.ex: My head was reeling. I felt hot all over.
example.tran: 我的头很晕。我感觉全身滚烫。

entry.def: You use hot to talk or ask about how high the temperature of something is.

example.ex: They are called incandescent lights, and their colour depends on how hot they are...
example.tran: 这种灯叫做白炽灯，其颜色取决于温度。

example.ex: Remember that the top of the oven will be hotter than the bottom.
example.tran: 记住，烤炉的顶部将比底部温度更高。

entry.def: Hot food is intended to be eaten as soon as it is cooked, as opposed to food that you eat when it has cooled or that you do not cook at all.

example.ex: If you live alone, you might not want to cook a hot meal every day.
example.tran: 如果单身居住，你可能不会想每天都做一顿热菜热饭。

entry.def: You can say that food is hot when it has a strong, burning taste caused by chillies, pepper, or ginger.

example.ex: ...hot curries.
example.tran: 辛辣的咖喱食品

example.ex: ...a dish that's spicy but not too hot.
example.tran: 加了香料但并不太辣的菜

entry.tran: （议题、话题）热门的，受到广泛关注的
entry.def: A hot issue or topic is one that is very important at the present time and is receiving a lot of publicity.

example.ex: The role of women in war has been a hot topic of debate in America since the Gulf conflict.
example.tran: 自海湾冲突以来，妇女在战争中的作用一直是美国国内一个备受争议的热门话题。

entry.tran: （消息）刚发布的，最新的，新近的
entry.def: Hot news is new, recent, and fresh.

example.ex: ...eight pages of the latest movies, video releases and the hot news from Tinseltown.
example.tran: 有关上档电影、发行影碟及好莱坞最新消息的8页报道

entry.tran: 风行的;走红的;炙手可热的
entry.def: You can use hot to describe something that is very exciting and that many people want to see, use, obtain, or become involved with.

example.ex: The hottest show in town was the Monet Exhibition at the Art Institute...
example.tran: 全城最轰动的展览是在美术学院举办的莫奈画展。

example.ex: When I was last there, the hot place was the Royal Bachelors' Club.
example.tran: 我上次在那里时，最热闹的地方是皇家单身汉俱乐部。

entry.tran: （常指非法获得的贵重或知名物品）烫手的，难以销赃的
entry.def: You can use hot to describe something that no one wants to deal with, often because it has been illegally obtained and is very valuable or famous.

example.ex: If too much publicity is given to the theft of important works, the works will become too hot to handle and be destroyed.
example.tran: 如果重要作品遭窃一事被大肆报道，这些作品就会因为难以转手而被销毁。

entry.def: You can describe a situation that is created by a person's behaviour or attitude as hot when it is unpleasant and difficult to deal with.

example.ex: When the streets get too hot for them, they head south in one stolen car after another.
example.tran: 当他们觉得在街头混不下去了时，就沿途不断偷车换开，一路往南去了。

entry.tran: （比赛）激烈的，双方全力以赴的
entry.def: A hot contest is one that is intense and involves a great deal of activity and determination.

example.ex: It took hot competition from abroad, however, to show us just how good Scottish cashmere really is.
example.tran: 然而，我们是通过来自国外的激烈竞争才认识到了苏格兰羊绒的优良品质。

entry.tran: 被看好的;最有望获胜的
entry.def: If a person or team is the hot favourite, people think that they are the one most likely to win a race or competition.

example.ex: Atlantic City is the hot favourite to stage the fight.
example.tran: 在大西洋城举行这场拳击比赛是众望所归。

entry.def: Someone who has a hot temper gets angry very quickly and easily.

example.ex: His hot temper was making it increasingly difficult for others to work with him.
example.tran: 他的火暴脾气使得别人越来越难以和他合作。

entry.def: If someone blows hot and cold, they keep changing their attitude towards something, sometimes being very enthusiastic and at other times expressing no interest at all.

example.ex: The media, meanwhile, has blown hot and cold on the affair.
example.tran: 同时，媒体对这件事的态度表现得忽冷忽热。

entry.tran: 焦虑不安;六神无主;举止失常
entry.def: If you are hot and bothered, you are so worried and anxious that you cannot think clearly or behave sensibly.

example.ex: Ray was getting very hot and bothered about the idea.
example.tran: 这个想法让雷心慌意乱。

entry.def: If you say that one person has the hots for another, you mean that they feel a strong sexual attraction to that person.

example.ex: I've had the hots for him ever since he came to college.
example.tran: 自从他来上大学后，我就对他春心萌动。

means.word_mean: 1. used of physical heat; having a high or higher than desirable temperature or giving off heat or feeling or causing a sensation of heat or burning;
2. characterized by violent and forceful activity or movement; very intense;
3. extended meanings; especially of psychological heat; marked by intensity or vehemence especially of passion or enthusiasm;
9. performed or performing with unusually great skill and daring and energy;
10. having a piquant burning taste of spices or peppers;

sentences.sentence: "cabbage patch dolls were hot last season"

means.word_mean: 14. having or bringing unusually good luck;
15. very good; often used in the negative;

sentences.sentence: "he's hot at math but not so hot at history"

means.word_mean: 17. capable of quick response and great speed;
18. having or showing great eagerness or enthusiasm;
19. of a seeker; near to the object sought;
20. having or dealing with dangerously high levels of radioactivity;

sentences.sentence: "a hot week on the stock market"

example.en: I didn't flunk,but my record isn't so hot.
example.zh: 我考试是及格了，不过分数不高。

example.en: His hot pants will get him in trouble.
example.zh: 他的好色将来会让他吃苦头的。

example.en: Catherine the Great was apparently an imperal hot pants.
example.zh: 叶卡捷琳娜一世显然是个风流女皇。

list.explanation: 心情不安，尴尬处境，处于困境

example.en: The poor jerk's on the hot seat for for getting to shut the safe.
example.zh: 那可怜的傻瓜因忘了锁保险柜而坐立不安。

example.en: If you're in the hot seat, he'll fight for you.
example.zh: 假若你有闲难，他会出力相助的。

auth_sentence.content: Above in the velvet vault the stars burned hot.
auth_sentence.res_content: Above in the velvet vault the stars burned hot.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Above in the velvet vault the stars burned hot.

auth_sentence.content: It should come out completely clean and feel hot.
auth_sentence.res_content: It should come out completely clean and feel hot.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It should come out completely clean and feel hot.

auth_sentence.content: Kyle Eastwood's band are a hot live act.
auth_sentence.res_content: Kyle Eastwood's band are a hot live act.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Kyle Eastwood's band are a hot live act.

Sentence.sentence: Solar homes produce the most power on the hot sunny afternoons when everyone rushes home to turn up the air conditioner.
The city is very hot this time of the year.
The privacy issue has already landed Facebook in hot water in Washington.
James hiked, fished, learnt to sail and experimented with hot air ballooning.
It has now become a hot topic in the United States.
Some iced coffees have as many calories as a hot dinner.

means.word_mean: 热的, 烫的, 温度高的

sentences.en: A blast of hot air blows in.

sentences.cn: 他卖的热烙饼味道真好。

sentences.en: It was so hot that we had to have the air conditioner on all day long.
sentences.cn: 天太热, 我们不得不整天开着空调。

means.word_mean: 棘手的, 争议大的; 艰难的; 危险的

sentences.en: Hot words were exchanged between the two men.
sentences.cn: 两人之间激烈争吵起来。

sentences.en: He came in rather hot about it.
sentences.cn: 他进来时对此颇不满意。

means.word_mean: 刚做好的; 最新的; 热门的

jushi.english: All I want is a hot bath.
jushi.chinese: 我所需要的就是洗个热水澡。

jushi.english: Hot words were exchanged between the two men.
jushi.chinese: 两人之间激烈争吵起来。

jushi.english: It was bitterly cold walking home tonight but the thought of a hot drink in the house spurred me on.
jushi.chinese: 今晚步行回家非常寒冷,但是想到能在家里喝上一杯热饮我就来劲了。
